_comment: Recommended MCP server configurations. MCP is OPT-IN — nothing is installed by default. Replace credential placeholders with actual values.
_opt_in_notice: To use MCP: copy the server block(s) you want into your platform's config file (see below). Never commit credentials.

github._description: GitHub integration — PRs, issues, repos, code search. Preferred: remote hosted endpoint (no local install needed).
github._status: supported — use remote/docker, NOT the deprecated @modelcontextprotocol/server-github npm package
github._option_a_remote: Remote hosted (requires client support for SSE + GitHub token):
github._scopes: Required token scopes: repo, read:org, read:user

atlassian._description: Jira and Confluence — issue management, page editing. Uses Atlassian's official remote MCP server (no local install).
atlassian._auth: Authenticate via browser at https://mcp.atlassian.com when prompted

postgres._description: PostgreSQL — read-only database introspection and queries. Use a read-only DB user.

websearch._description: Web search via Tavily (preferred) — docs lookup, current events, research.
websearch._status: supported — requires Tavily API key (free tier available at https://tavily.com)
websearch._alt: Alternative: Brave Search MCP — npx @modelcontextprotocol/server-brave-search + BRAVE_API_KEY

sentry._description: Sentry — error tracking, issue details, stack traces.

groundcover._description: groundcover — cloud-native observability (APM, logs, metrics). Uses groundcover's MCP server.
groundcover._note: Contact groundcover for API key access if not already provisioned

filesystem._description: Enhanced filesystem access beyond default tools. Only add if your workflow needs paths outside the project.
filesystem._status: optional — only install if you have a specific need
filesystem._security: Only list paths you explicitly want the agent to access
